questions.question: How much intravenous, crystalloids fluid do you give at post-partum haemorrhage?
questions.description: You give 3 litres of intravenous, crystalloids fluid at post-partum haemorrhage. Give it fast!

questions.question: How can you make the intravenous fluids go in fast?
questions.description: You can make the intravenous fluids go in fast by compressing them with the hand or use of a blood pressure cuff.

answers.value: By compressing them with the hand or use of a blood pressure cuff
By puncturing the bag in the top

questions.question: What should you do if blood transfusion is available at your health facility?
questions.description: If blood transfusion is available at your health facility, you should take blood for blood type and cross-match.

answers.value: Take blood for blood type and cross-match

questions.question: What could be relevant analgesic drugs for Manual removal of the placenta?
questions.description:
Relevant analgesic drugs for Manual removal of the placenta could be:

Morphine

Diazepam

questions.question: Should you stop the aorta compression while giving pain relief?
questions.description: You should not stop the aorta compression while giving pain relief.

answers.value: Never start aorta compression until after proper pain relief
Yes, now you can end the aorta compression

keyLearningPointDetails.description: Gloves and manual removal of placenta

questions.question: What kind of gloves can be used for manual removal of the placenta?
questions.description: Either sterile elbow-long gloves, or normal sterile gloves, or examination gloves can be used for manual removal of the placenta.

keyLearningPointDetails.description: Right order for removal of placenta

questions.question: Once inside the uterus, how do you remove the placenta?
questions.description:
Once inside the uterus, you remove the placenta in the following way:

Use the edge of your flat hand to gently separate the placenta from the uterus.

Move the hand from side to side, once the placenta is loose, you gently pull it out.

answers.value: Use the edge of your flat hand to gently separate the placenta from the uterus
Move the hand from side to side, once the placenta is loose, you gently pull it out
Pull the placenta out with your fingers
Use your hands like claws and mash the placenta

questions.question: What is recommended to do right after manual removal of placenta?
questions.description:
Right after removal of placenta it is recommended to:

Massage the fundus to stimulate the uterus to contract
If still bleeding perform bimanual compression

answers.value: Refer the patient if she is still bleeding
Massage the fundus to stimulate the uterus to contract
If still bleeding perform bimanual compression

keyLearningPointDetails.description: The overall action to control PPH

questions.question: If you can’t remove the placenta completely you should
questions.description:
If you can’t remove the placenta completely you should

Perform condom tamponade.

Continue aorta compression if still bleeding.

Refer to a higher level health facility together with a health professional.

answers.value: Continue aorta compression if still bleeding
Refer to a higher level health facility together with a health professional
Refer to a higher level health facility unaccompanied

questions.question: When should you apply a condom balloon tamponade (CBT)?
questions.description: You should apply a condom balloon tamponade (CBT) in a situation where a bleeding doesn’t stop despite all possible non-surgical actions.

answers.value: In a situation where a bleeding doesn’t stop despite all possible non-surgical actions
All women bleeding more than 1 L must have a CBT for a minimum of 24 hours

questions.question: After manual removal of the placenta give the following drugs
questions.description:
After manual removal of the placenta give the following drugs:

Oxytocin 10 IU IM

Ergometrine 0.2 mg IV or IM

Ampicillin 2 g IV

questions.question: After the bleeding is controlled you:
questions.description:
After the bleeding is controlled you:

Monitor closely for the next 24 hours

Measure level of haemoglobin the next day (if test is available)

Recommend an iron supplement 120 mg twice daily for 3 months

answers.value: Monitor closely for the next 24 hours
Measure level of haemoglobin the next day (if test is available)
Recommend an iron supplement 120 mg twice daily for 3 months

questions.question: Is it safe to refer a woman with a retained placenta?
questions.description:
No! There is a high risk she will not survive the referral. Bleeding can be overwhelming.

Manual removal of the placenta is a Basic Emergency Obstetric and Neonatal Care signal function – and must be performed by any skilled birth attendant.

answers.value: No! There is a high risk she will not survive the referral. Bleeding can be overwhelming.
Manual removal of the placenta is a Basic Emergency Obstetric and Neonatal Care signal function – and must be performed by any skilled birth attendant
YES! The management is safest when performed at a high level health facility

questions.question: If you do not remember the dosages of antibiotics to the newborn, what do you do?
questions.description: If you do not remember the dosages of antibiotics to the newborn, you look in the Safe Delivery App film on Newborn Management or in the drug list.

answers.value: Look in the Safe Delivery App film on Newborn Management or in the drug list
Give what you think is the correct dose
Discharge the newborn and ask the mother to return if danger signs

questions.question: What is the dosage of Ampicillin and Gentamicin?
questions.description:
The dosage of Ampicillin and Gentamicin is:
Ampicillin 50 mg per kg IV or IM twice daily and Gentamicin 5 mg per kg IV or IM once daily

answers.value: Ampicillin 50 mg per kg IV or IM twice daily and Gentamicin 5 mg per kg IV or IM once daily
Ampicillin 5 mg per kg IV or IM twice daily and Gentamicin 50 mg per kg IV/IM once daily

questions.question: Manual removal of the placenta is a Basic Emergency Obstetric and Neonatal Care signal function – every skilled birth attendant must be able to perform it.
questions.description: True, manual removal of the placenta is a Basic Emergency Obstetric and Neonatal Care signal function – every skilled birth attendant must be able to perform it.

questions.question: After how long after delivery should manual removal of the placenta be performed?
questions.description: Manual removal of the placenta should be performed 30 minutes after delivery, or before if bleeding.

questions.question: Bleeding before delivery of the placenta is often heavy:
questions.description: Bleeding before delivery of the placenta is often heavy. The placenta receives up to one litre of blood per minute.

answers.value: True, the placenta receives up to one litre of blood per minute
False, the blood supply for the placenta is rather small
False, the blood coagulation will reduce bleeding fast
False, the placenta will compress the uterine cavity from the inside

questions.question: What are signs of excessive bleeding at retained placenta?
questions.description:
Signs of excessive bleeding at retained placenta are:

Excessive vaginal bleeding

Signs of circulatory compromise

questions.question: How can you stop the bleeding at retained placenta?
questions.description: You can stop the bleeding at retained placenta through Aorta Compression.

questions.question: What are parts of resuscitation at post-partum bleeding?
questions.description:
Parts of resuscitation at post-partum bleeding are:

Lie woman flat, head down

Insert 2 IV lines and give 3 litres of Ringer’s Lactate or Normal Saline fast

Give blood if available

answers.value: Insert 2 IV lines and give 3 litres of Ringer’s Lactate or Normal Saline fast

questions.question: Should you stop the aorta compression while resuscitating?
questions.description: No, you should not stop the aorta compression while resuscitating.

answers.value: The aorta compression does not start until after resuscitation
Yes, now you must end the aorta compression

keyLearningPointDetails.description: How to manually remove the placenta

questions.question: How do you start manual removal of the placenta?
questions.description:
You start manual removal of the placenta in the following way: 
One hand follows the umbilical cord inside the uterus, the other holds the uterus at the fundus.

answers.value: One hand follows the umbilical cord inside the uterus, the other holds the uterus at the fundus
One hand pulls the umbilical cord, the other pushes the uterus the other direction
One hand follows the umbilical cord inside the uterus, the other compresses the aorta
Both hands go inside the uterus

questions.question: Should you stop the aorta compression once you’ve started perform manual removal?
questions.description: No, you should not stop the aorta compression once you’ve started perform manual removal.

answers.value: Yes, otherwise you can’t perform the procedure
Do never start aorta compression until after removal of the placenta
Yes now you can end the aorta compression

questions.question: After the placenta is out, what do you do?
questions.description: After the placenta is out, you repeat intrauterine palpation until you are sure all parts of placenta, membranes and blood clots are out.

answers.value: Repeat intrauterine palpation until you are sure all parts of placenta, membranes and blood clots are out

questions.question: Should you stop the aorta compression once you finished manual removal?
questions.description: No, you should not stop the aorta compression once you finished manual removal. Continue until bleeding is controlled.

answers.value: Yes, now the situation is under control
Never start aorta compression until after removal of the placenta
No, continue until bleeding is controlled
Yes, you should have stopped already at the beginning of the procedure

questions.question: What are the actions to control a bleeding after manual removal of placenta?
questions.description:
The actions to control a bleeding after manual removal of placenta:	
- Bimanual compression
- Aorta compression
- Balloon tamponade

questions.question: After manual removal of the placenta:
questions.description: After manual removal of the placenta there is often continuous bleeding due to poor tone of the uterus or clotting disorders.

answers.value: There is often continuous bleeding due to poor tone of the uterus or clotting disorders
The bleeding will usually stop by itself
You must never give uterotonic drugs

keyLearningPointDetails.description: Action right after removal of placenta

questions.question: After manual removal of the placenta what do you do if there is continuous bleeding?
questions.description:
If there is continuous bleeding after manual removal of the placenta, you:

Perform bimanual compression of the uterus and/ or aorta compression

Give Uterotonic drugs and continue monitoring of vital signs

Continue fluid resuscitation

answers.value: Perform bimanual compression of the uterus and/ or aorta compression
Give Uterotonic drugs and continue monitoring of vital signs
Refer to a higher level health facility
